title: How to start being good with money? What books should I read - Quora

response.answer_text: You already have the first step done: you have your goals. You want to be financially well off to the point of buying your own house. The next step is tracking your income and expenses. Do you have bank accounts? Find your bank statements and figure out how much money you make each month and categorize the spending you do. This will give you how much you earn, spend, and save each month. If there is negative dollars left over, then it might be best to look at your spending and figure out if there is anything you can do to reduce your spending. There are numerous ways to cut your spending. Below are two categories that people will commonly cut to save money. Identify recurring payments which don’t bring much happiness and negotiate for less or CUT completelyCableInternetPhone BillFun experiences + FoodDo you really need to have 5 beers and drinks vs. 3 beers and drinks every time you go out? (at least around me, that’s a difference of $15 a night I go out)Going out to eat vs. eating in can save you thousands over a life time.Next, make sure to SAVE or PAY DOWN any debts you have with the remainder of the money you have at the end of each month. At this point, it’s about staying consistent and learning about personal finance. So you are right in asking the question, what books would be good for me to read? There are three books I’ll offer up for you which have been impactful in my financial situation and life.    Best of luck. Feel free to reach out with any other questions. Check out my blog for some more financial education tips: The Mastermind Within and my book recommendations for personal finance.
